abstract: Just 24 hours after American officials announced that they had disrupted an Iranian plot that sounded like a rejected Quentin Tarantino script -- centering on an Iranian-American used-car salesman's failed attempt to hire a Mexican drug cartel to assassinate Saudi Arabia's ambassador in Washington -- a number of prominent American experts on Iran have suggested that Iran's government might not have been behind the scheme at all.

headline.main: Some Experts Question Iran's Role in Bungled Plot
